content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one! The logic is sound, and the Zero edge case (0 -> 10) is a smart trap! :)

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I would really have prefered nines' complements to tens' complements, but that's on me. LGTM

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting clash with clear rules in Fastest mode that can get quite tricky in Reverse mode.
DONE!

I can't change it now bc:

Oops
An error occurred (#572): "You do not have the last contribution version"

Input
* Please move everything to the Goal section.

* Please use this instead:

<<Line 1>>: A string [[S]] to transform.

Output
* Please remove everything from "where digits" to the end.

Constraints
* Please format "S" as a [[variable]].

* Please change 500 to 10 (which may be increased if you introduce longer inputs).

Stub generator
* Please change 500 to 10 (which may be increased if you introduce longer inputs).

Cases
* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs and outputs. Please revise the cases accordingly.

* Please cover all digits and all letters in both cases in the visible tests.

* Please cover all digits and all letters in both cases in the hidden validators.

* The existing "Long String" isn't actually that long. Please rename the case.

Thanks.
Thank you for the feedback!
Just refresh the page and do it again. Before refreshing, copy any text if needed to avoid having to re-type it later.

Please revise as follows:

Input
* Please use the following description instead.

<<Line 1>>: A string [[S]] to transform.

Output
* Please use the following description instead.

<<Line 1>>: The transformed string.

Constraints
* Please change "[[The Length Of the string S]]" to "length of [[S]]". Note that only "S" is the variable name.

Cases
* Please cover the remaining digits and letters (234678, dfghijkpqrstuvwxyz, all uppercase letters except H) in one or more visible tests. Use meaningful words as much as possible.

* Please cover the remaining digits and letters (23478, bcdejmopqstuvwx, BCDEFGHIJKLMNQRSVWXYZ) in one or more hidden validators. Use meaningful words as much as possible.

Just a reminder that in order for me or others to be notified of your replies, you'll need to reply to an existing comment rather than starting a new one.

Thanks.

I think that All of the letters and numbers are too much test cases (I don't want to be the clash too overwhelming with too many test cases). I can do all the numbers (24678) but maybe not all the letters what I didn't use.




P.S. I'm 11 and I want to program, so I am a beginner.
My native language Is Chzech, but I speak english.

Tysm!

Jazz

You can use more digits and letters in the earlier cases so that you don't have to add many new cases. Adequate coverage is important so that the players' codes are checked correctly.

No worries about the language! I understand your messages perfectly.

You may search websites like this for some inspiration:

https://www.graceguts.com/digressions/short-sentences-with-every-letter-of-the-alphabet
I don't know where I can put All of the remaining letters. I think it's fine to leave it like this.
As I mentioned, you can modify earlier cases before you start adding new cases.

One possible way to cover all the letters is to use four of the sentences in the website quoted earlier. Convert two of them to all lowercase, and convert the remaining two to all uppercase, and use them as input. Some of the existing cases may be redundant and can be removed.

Also make sure all the digits are covered in the tests and all the digits are covered in the validators.

The case coverage should become sufficient after doing both of the above points.
OOH smart

The new cases are a good improvement, but they're still not sufficient. In addition, the descriptions of the Input and Output sections remain incorrect. Please address the following points, and I'll withdraw my rejection of your contribution.

Input
* Please use the following description instead.

<<Line 1>>: A string [[S]] to transform.

Output
* Please use the following description instead.

<<Line 1>>: The transformed string.

Cases
* Test 5: Please add the digits 3, 4, 7 and 8 to the input.

* Validator 5: Please add the digits 3 and 7 to the input.

* Test 6: Please make the input longer and ensure it includes the letters fgjvwxzCDKSTU. For example, the input could be updated to:

HAppY 2026! fox jUmpS over wizarD DUCK gifT, OK?

* Validator 6: Please make the input longer and ensur it includes the letters bdmptvwCEFGHJKNQSXZ. For example, the input could be updated to:

4682 Yellow bravE FOXES Jump QuiCKly, tHeN Go doZing?

* Test 7: Please replace the non-ASCII character "‚Äî" with "-" in both the input and the output.

Thanks.
Done everything!
Many thanks! üëç

Thanks A MIllion For the feedback!!!!!

Jazz
